channel.title: cs.MS updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: cs.MS updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: MPPI-Generic: A CUDA Library for Stochastic Trajectory Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2409.07563v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This paper introduces a new C++/CUDA library for GPU-accelerated stochastic optimization called MPPI-Generic. It provides implementations of Model Predictive Path Integral control, Tube-Model Predictive Path Integral Control, and Robust Model Predictive Path Integral Control, and allows for these algorithms to be used across many pre-existing dynamics models and cost functions. Furthermore, researchers can create their own dynamics models or cost functions following our API definitions without needing to change the actual Model Predictive Path Integral Control code. Finally, we compare computational performance to other popular implementations of Model Predictive Path Integral Control over a variety of GPUs to show the real-time capabilities our library can allow for. Library code can be found at: https://acdslab.github.io/mppi-generic-website/ .
item.dc:creator: Bogdan Vlahov, Jason Gibson, Manan Gandhi, Evangelos A. Theodorou

item.title: Dual-Regularized Riccati Recursions for Interior-Point Optimal Control
item.description: arXiv:2509.16370v5 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We derive closed-form extensions of Riccati's recursions (both sequential and parallel) for solving dual-regularized LQR problems. We show how these methods can be used to solve general constrained, non-convex, discrete-time optimal control problems via a regularized interior point method, while guaranteeing that each primal step is a descent direction of an Augmented Barrier-Lagrangian merit function. We provide MIT-licensed implementations of our methods in C++ and JAX.
item.dc:creator: Jo\~ao Sousa-Pinto, Dominique Orban
